cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 195 mi SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then turning northeast and east after Florida landfall; forecast to track along or just inland of the GA/SC/NC coasts and exit off the North Carolina coast late Thursday–early Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Cedar Key/Yankeetown

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City, NC to the NC/VA border, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet, FL northward to Surf City, NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast Big Bend, then the entire Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (peak sustained 35–45 kt with higher gusts) are possible late Wed night through Thu as the center passes nearby.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge/inundation possible along the Cape Fear River and adjacent coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals likely; risk of flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer bands; dangerous rip currents and rough surf that could hamper vessel movements.
